name: Kwame Nkrumah Mausoleum
description: A memorial dedicated to Ghana's first President, featuring a museum and serene gardens.

name: Jamestown Lighthouse
description: A historic lighthouse offering panoramic views of the city and fishing harbor.

name: Makola Market
description: A bustling open-air market known for its vibrant atmosphere and diverse goods.

name: Black Star Square
description: A public square and monument dedicated to Ghanaian independence from British colonial rule.

name: Osu Castle
description: Also known as Fort Christiansborg, this historic site served as the seat of government.

name: National Museum of Ghana
description: Showcasing Ghana's rich cultural history and heritage through artifacts and exhibitions.

name: W.E.B. Du Bois Centre
description: A research and memorial center dedicated to the life of the Pan-Africanist writer and activist.

name: Labadi Beach
address: La Teshie Beach Rd, Accra, Ghana
description: One of Accra's most popular beaches, offering food stalls, live music, and a lively atmosphere.
